channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Pagcor distributes PPE to public hospitals
item.description: To help thwart the high incidence of COVID-19 infections among healthcare workers due to lack of personal protective equipment, the Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp. distributed additional PPE to several public hospitals this week.

item.title: House conducts hearing on AFP, PNP actions
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House committee on public order and safety yesterday pushed for stricter enforcement of enhanced community quarantine measures against the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic through imposition of fines on violators.

item.title: Duterte slams Reds for attacks on troops
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: There will be a time of reckoning for the communist rebels who attacked government troops involved in the delivery of relief assistance to people affected by the enhanced community quarantine, President Duterte said on Monday night.

item.title: P20 million for any Pinoy who develops respirator
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte is offering a P20-million reward to any Filipino who develops respirators for patients infected with the coronavirus disease 2019, Malacañang announced yesterday.

item.title: Lawmakers file bill on ‘new normal’
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: House leaders yesterday filed a bill that would institutionalize new norms of physical distancing in public places and other safety measures such as wearing of face masks after the lifting of the enhanced community quarantine and resumption of businesses.

item.title: The DTI is recommending the following sectors to be allowed to resume operations during the GCQ:
item.description: Stores in malls and commercial centers like hardware stores, clothing and accessories and non-leisure stores; barbershops, salon and spas, and other personal care industries but with strict health standards; wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles; construction and projects under the Build, Build, Build program; forestry and logging; publishing activities; motion picture, video and television program production, sound recording and music publishing activities; and advertising and market research.

item.title: Depression on the rise due to ECQ
item.author: Büm D. Tenorio Jr.
item.description: Expect the number of individuals with depression to rise in the country following the prolonged lockdown.

item.title: HEIs not under ECQ allowed to finish academic year
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Higher education institutions in areas not under enhanced community quarantine are allowed to operate and wrap up their assessments for academic year 2019-2020, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: Hotel health protocols readied
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: The Department of Tourism as well as tourism stakeholders are emphasizing the need for safety protocols for the operations of accommodation establishments in areas to be placed under general community quarantine.

item.title: DOH gets DBM nod to hire 15,000 health workers
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government will hire more than 15,000 health workers to increase the number of frontliners in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.
